thread.title: Russia deputy PM says international relations should not depend on one person's mood

title: Russia deputy PM says international relations should not depend on one person's mood
text:
April 13, 2018 / 7:28 AM / Updated 43 minutes ago Russia deputy PM says international relations should not depend on one person's mood Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
MOSCOW (Reuters) - Russian Deputy Prime Minister Arkady Dvorkovich said that international relations should not depend on the mood of one person when he wakes up in the morning, in reference to U.S. President Donald Trumpâ€™s tweets, RIA news agency reported on Friday. Russian Deputy Prime Minister Arkady Dvorkovich smiles during an interview at the St. Petersburg International Economic Forum (SPIEF), Russia, June 2, 2017. REUTERS/Sergei Karpukhin 
Dvorkovich, speaking at a forum in Krasnoyarsk, said that Russia was not prepared for such risks. Reporting by Denis Pinchuk; Writing by Maria Tsvetkova; Editing by Hugh Lawson
